1. Starting from the app\'s main menu select the Read button. This will bring you to the Library
2. The Library will show you all adventures on your phone and if you have internet connection all of the adventures online.
3. Press on any adventure title in the list to read it or click the I\'m feeling lucky button to get a random adventure
4. The Adventure will open showing you text and images which you can read. Once you are done reading select the button at the bottom to continue.
5. A list of choices will be displayed. Pick the one that you think is the best by tapping the choices description or select the random choice button to be sent to a random choice
6. Repeat step 4 until the button at the bottom says Main Menu. This means your story is done and you will be sent back to the library.
1. From the main menu select the \"Edit\" button. This will take you to the Library of editable stories
2. You will see all downloaded adventures. Select an adventures title to open it for edit or \"New Adventure\" to create a new adventure
3. a) At the top of the page you can change the adventures title this will be seen by all who read the adventure
3. b) In the box in the middle you can select an existing section to edit it. The section titled \"Start\" is special and place where the reader will start their adventure
3. c) At the bottom you can press the button to add a new section.
1. At the top left is the editable section title. This will not be seen by the reader and is used only for the editor to differentiate stories
2. INSERT TEXT adds a text box to the section
3. INSERT IMAGE lets you add an image to the section.
3. a) Once the insert image button has been pressed your camera app will open
3. b) After taking a picture you can choose to keep it and it will be inserted or retake it
4. The middle is where the sections content will be displayed
5. The modify choices button will allow you to edit the choices that are linked to by this section
1. The top section displays the choices that will be displayed to the reader when they select continue
2. The bottom section is a list of sections which can be linked to by the current section
3. a) This will create a new blank section that can be edited later
3. b) The section title is only viewable by the editor.
3. c) The choices description is the reader visable text they will see when trying to decide which chocie to take
Adventure: A choose your own Adventure story that can consist of Sections. A user can read or edit an Adventure.
Annotation: Content (either text or an image) added by a User to add to an existing Media in a Section they are reading.
Browse: To look through a list of adventures or sections.
Cache Story: Save an adventure in memory that can be loaded later, such as when the phone goes offline, or when the phone has been restarted.
Choice: A point in an Adventure that a User must make a decision that will change what the user will experience next. This is done by change sections

Choice Description: Each decision that a user can make at the end of a section is labeled with a Choice Description. When a user clicks on the button corresponding the a choice description, they will move forward to the section corresponding to that choice description. Each choice description has one section, but a section can be linked to by many choice descriptions. In other words, this is "what the user does next". Downloaded: See "cache".
Edit: This mode allows Users to become Writers.
Library: A collection of all Adventures currently in the system.
Media: Text, image, video, or music that make up a Section in an Adventure.
Publish: To upload an adventure onto the online repository.
Read: This mode allows Users to browse Adventures and to choose one to enjoy. The User will start in the start Section and at the end of each section make a choice to move onto a new section.
Search: Allows a User to search through available Adventures looking for titles that contain a certain word or phrase.

Section: A self contained part of an Adventure, it ends with a choice that will take the User to another Section. In the user requirements this is referred to as a fragment. The word fragment isn\'t used due to possible confusion with android fragments.
User: A person who uses the app to read Adventures.
Writer: A user that is editing an Adventure to add a Section, or a Section to add Media. Writers can also add new Adventures.
